data.message: 4/5. Eminem has good shit as usual, however i can't stand Yelawolf and Slaughterhouse on this album. They just bring the quality down. Idk this might just be me... Love each of Eminem's songs and his verses on other songs though!

replies.message: Seriously? i thought yela crooked and royce were great
It's not just an EMINEM cd. It's like the re-up dipshits.
Psychopath killer, twisted and vegas are dope tracks buddy!
Each and every one of them killed it. This album is celebrating 15 years of Shady Records, so why wouldn't Em put Slaughterhouse and Yelawolf on the album?
I never said he shouldn't have, I'm just saying it would be better in my opinion if he hadn't. Royce and Em killed it... Also, Big Sean is terrible............
Psychopath Killer was dope as fuck. Y'all Ready Know was dope. Yela has an aquired taste type of style. But you cannot say he doesn't have top notcb skills.
Yeah, Bit Sean spit the best verse of his life, and it was awful. Danny Brown held up better, but not by much.
I've tried to listen to Yelawolf in the past, and I just can't. He never has impressed me, and listening to this album, he still has yet to.
Another Leaked http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=9Y6_QRVKRUE
Like I said. Aquired taste. I'm not a Yelawolf fan, but, dude has skills.
I thought Yela did great on Twisted. Royce was good, Big Sean blew, Danny Brown was cool.
It should just be em and yelawolf. Yelawolf has crazy flow and can sound good with em
I actually think Yelawolf really shines on this album from his hook in Psychopath Killer and his verses on his song Down and Twisted... And I'm not a big Yela fan but I do gotta pay respect haha
Slaughterhouse are lyrically geniuses!!! Royce can actually compete with eminem, how the helll you think slaughterhouse arent good lolll
I think Yela went in on this... And that Slaughterhouse track is amazing! Royce and Em are expected to snap so there is no real element of surprise with their verses.

Yelawolf is good but he's not even at eminems level 10 years ago, i liked his hook on P.K, That D12 song, i dunno, Royce was not up to par looking at his performance on the Hell: the sequel EP, he gave Em a run for his money, the other. members, i dunno as well. 4/5
I disagree, there both great artists compared to the mainstream rap shit your here nowadays..
Yelawolf has some amazing flow, just listen to animal, he continuously raps fast and can do it live no problem

Yelawolf is better on Twisted than Eminem. I actually prefer his current flow to Eminems, as hell... Eminem is so fast it gets annoying. And that is so because he didn't used to be like that when I loved his music. Now I just like it
Yela wolf in my opinion is terrible but I fucking love slaughterhouse there album was insane
Royce is probably the most underrated mc eva!!
Agreed
Dude Yelawolf and Slaughterhouse murdered those tracks! Ur nuts
you don't listen to hip hop man.. yelawolf and SPECIALLY slaughterhouse kept it real on this one, stick to the magic of the classics man

Yelawolf is the shit. Like he said in Down. 

"Cause Marshalls a rap god, damn right. Well then I guess that makes me jesus."
